pullRequest.title: Add a new hard goal that ensures that each alive broker has a leader replica from a configured pool of topics

nodes.bodyText:
cruise-control-code module contains the system agnostic logic of Cruise Control. However, this utility function is about Kafka topics -- i.e. it is system-specific.
Can we move this to the relevant utility class under cruise-control module?

minLeaderReplicaCountForTopicsMustHaveLeaderReplicaPerBroker is relevant to a single hard goal.
Whereas OptimizationOptions intends to contain common options applicable to the overall optimization process.

Can we refrain from making changes in the optimization options and instead modify BalancingConstraint to add the relevant constraints?
Going forward (not on this PR), we can create an interface for BalancingConstraint, and enable users to implement this interface to address the needs for their custom goals.
If we refrain from making changes in the optimization options and instead modify BalancingConstraint to add the relevant constraints, we can drop these new variables.

This should be a regex -- i.e. not a list (?) of topic names, because cluster operators may not always know the exact topic names, but they may know the prefix, suffix, or other relevant generic naming schemes about relevant topics. In such cases, regex provides more flexibility -- please see TOPICS_EXCLUDED_FROM_PARTITION_MOVEMENT_CONFIG for example use.

For conciseness and consistency between relevant configs, can we use

topics.must.have.leader.replica.per.broker -> topics.with.min.leaders.per.broker
min.leader.replica.count.per.broker.for.topics.must.have.leader.replica.per.broker -> min.topic.leaders.per.broker (the documentation of this config can explain that this config is applicable to the topics specified by the topics.with.min.leaders.per.broker config)

Would renaming this goal as follows make its purpose more clear?:

LeaderReplicaPerLiveBrokerGoal -> MinTopicLeadersPerBrokerGoal?

Can we ensure that this JavaDoc explains how it uses the two new AnalyzerConfigs?
"... ensure that each alive broker has ..." -> Does this goal omit brokers excluded for replica moves or not (it should)?
Please see earlier comment on moving these variables to BalancingConstraint.
Please see earlier comment on moving these variables to BalancingConstraint.

nodes.bodyText: moves has at minimum number -> moves has at least the minimum number
I believe this is not just required for unit test -- also required for regular use case. Can we remove or fix this comment?
have a minimum number -> have at least a minimum number

From our earlier discussion, I remember that doing a pattern match is an expensive operation. Can be more efficient by doing the following:

In initGoalState method of this goal, calculate the set of all topics relevant to this goal (see KafkaCruiseControl#excludedTopics(ClusterModel, Pattern) regarding how this can ben done),
then keep the result in a local hashset.
In places, where the check is relevant (e.g. in actionAcceptance), just use set,contains().
This should be cached and the response should be used wherever needed (please see earlier comment on the changes on init function)

Can we simplify the content of this function as follows?
return (int) replicasOfTopicInBroker(topic).stream().filter(r -> r.isLeader() == countLeaderReplica).count();
Can we drop this unused function from the class?
Utils.getTopicNamesMatchedWithPattern(...) will also perform the empty pattern check and return an empty set. Can we eliminate repeated check for empty pattern?
Utils.getTopicNamesMatchedWithPattern(...) will also perform the empty pattern check and return an empty set. Can we eliminate repeated check for empty pattern?
Why do we use a list rather than a set? Does the order matter or do we expect to handle repeated entries?
If this is a replica swap operation, then this check might miss destination topic that might be relevant to this goal. This may cause accepting a replica swap that it was supposed to reject.

This should never happen. Even if happens, this should never return true. This is a correctness issue.

Given that we know that this function will receive either a (1) leadership or (2) inter-broker replica moves for sure, can we remove any handling for swap and unknown balancing action -- i.e. drop the swap-case please?
Moving a non-leader replica is acceptable only if the replica is offline and the action is a replica move. This is not a self satisfied action.

By design, this function should not be called with

a non-leader replica -- please drop check on if (!replicaToBeMoved.isLeader()).
with replicas from topics other than _mustHaveTopicLeadersPerBroker -- please drop check on if (!_mustHaveTopicLeadersPerBroker.contains(topicName)).
offline replicas because this is already done in the proposed simplified version of selfSatisfied(also destinationBroker should not be dead if it is proposed here) -- please drop check on if (!sourceBroker.isAlive() && destinationBroker.isAlive())

-- See my comment above on the proposed simplified version of selfSatisfied.
numLeaderReplicasOfTopicInBroker -> numLeadersFor
Can we drop this function and move its content to numLeaderReplicasOfTopicInBroker? We are using it only as part of counting leaders, so filtering can be based on leadership.

Shouldn't this be
return sourceBroker.numLeaderReplicasOfTopicInBroker(topicName) > minTopicLeadersPerBroker();

Otherwise your move can cause (1) the source broker to have fewer than intended number of replicas from the topic or (2) extra replica moves from source to other brokers and from other brokers to source to compensate for the missing topic replicas.
Am I missing something?
-- Also with this change and all the other changes proposed above, this function will have a single line of code, which is only called from selfSatisfied. Hence, it can be deleted and its content can be moved to selfSatisfied.
clusterModel.brokers()) -> clusterModel.aliveBrokers

There is no need for this micro-optimization. The next call to maybeApplyBalancingAction  will already fail with a null response and we will throw the exception. Please drop this check.
-- also incorrect exception message. Isn't this function trying to move offline replicas -- i.e. not all replicas.

This whole filtering is redundant. The return value of this function is used in maybeApplyBalancingAction. But if we check the content of this function, we will notice that (1) it does the same filtering for excluded brokers for both leadership and replica moves and (2) it does not move a replica to a broker that has the same replica, because it is not a legitMove.

just use:

    SortedSet<Broker> sortedBrokers = new TreeSet<>(
        Comparator.comparingInt((Broker broker) -> broker.replicas().size()).thenComparingInt(Broker::id));
    sortedBrokers.addAll(clusterModel.aliveBrokers());


delete findEligibleBrokersToMoveOfflineReplicasTo  and move its content to moveAwayOfflineReplicas?

Replica leader = clusterModel.partition(followerReplica.topicPartition()).leader();
By construction of cluster model, we can assume that each partition has a leader -- Can we drop leader==null check?

leader.broker().id() != broker.id() -> the leader is the leader replica of the partition that the followerReplica belongs to. Given that a replica cannot be a follower and a leader at the same time, isn't this check a no-op?

Each call to brokerHasSufficientLeadersOfTopic is performed within a loop here. But this is costly. We know that every time a balancing action succeeds, it would move only one leader into this broker. So we can just get the count once before the loop, and then increment the value in a variable as necessary, which is cheaper.

    clusterModel.aliveBrokers()

See similar comment above.

Do we even need this check? Isn't it guaranteed to be true if we reach here based on the current codepath?
